step.title: Storage of the modules in the recycling area

paragraph.htmltext:
The modules entering the recycling process can be first placed in storage. These modules are:

  • scrap modules from the production process
  • resulting from the pack disassembling

During the storage of the modules the main risk is thermal runway. By checking the temperature of the modules (especially after moving the modules) regular the start of a thermal runaway can be detected. The area in which the modules are stored shall be well ventilated.

The storage in which the modules are placed can be adapted to the specific risks.

In case of a fire information about the stored goods must be given to the fire brigade. This can be done via the ‘Information for rescue and emergency services 1ste and 2nd responders – Lithium-ion batteries in a storage facility’. This document is currently designed by CTIF and Recharge and is part of the program of given uniform information to rescue and emergency services.

Background information on how to safely store Lithium-ion batteries, how to early detect a fire and how to act in the different stages is described in the guidelines of safely storing batteries.
